com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.account

Interface AccountResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultAccountResolver

    public interface AccountResolver
    An AccountResolver can inspect a ServletRequest and return any Account that may be associated with the request due to a previous authentication.
    Since:
    1.0.RC3

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static AccountResolver INSTANCE
      A thread-safe instance to use as desired.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Account getAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
      Returns the current user account associated with the specified request or null if no user account is associated with the request.
      Account getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
      Returns the current user account identity associated with the request or throws an IllegalArgumentException exception if there is no account associated with the request.
      boolean hasAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
      Returns true if the specified request has an associated user account identity, false otherwise.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        static final AccountResolver INSTANCE
        A thread-safe instance to use as desired. The implementation is a DefaultAccountResolver.

    • Method Detail

      • hasAccount

        boolean hasAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
        Returns true if the specified request has an associated user account identity, false otherwise. Often used as a guard/check before executing getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest).
        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        true if the specified request has an associated user account identity, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest)

      • getAccount

        Account getAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
        Returns the current user account associated with the specified request or null if no user account is associated with the request.

        In security-sensitive workflows, it might be better to use getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest) to help eliminate NullPointerExceptions and conditional branching bugs.

        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        the current user account associated with the specified request or null if no user account is associated with the request.
        See Also:
        hasAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest), getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest)

      • getRequiredAccount

        Account getRequiredAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the current user account identity associated with the request or throws an IllegalArgumentException exception if there is no account associated with the request.

        Often this method will be used within a conditional, first checking that hasAccount(javax.servlet.ServletRequest) returns true, for example:

             if (AccountResolver.INSTANCE.hasAccount(servletRequest)) {

         Account account = AccountResolver.INSTANCE.getRequiredAccount(servletRequest);
         //do something with the account

     }
        This check-then-use pattern helps eliminate NullPointerExceptions and conditional branching bugs when working with user identities - often desirable in sensitive logic.
        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        the current user account identity associated with the request
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
